newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIA-SEARCH FOR TELECOM SELL-OFF ADVISOR NARROWED.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIA-SEARCH FOR TELECOM SELL-OFF ADVISOR NARROWED.

text.p: Lithuania's European affairs ministry said on Wednesday that it had narrowed its search for an advisor to assist in the privatisation of Lithuanian Telecom.
"Terms of references for the companies on the short-list interested in participating in the bid will be sent on Monday," Vytenis Junevichius, an offical in the ministry, told Reuters.
The ministry said earlier that it had received 23 applications to act as lead advisor in the privatisation of the state-run telephone giant.
"The optimal number of companies to participate in the tender would be six but the short-list...could contain ten," Junevichius said.
Junevichius said that the companies will be expected to submit their proposals one month after the invitations for the tender are sent.
"The lead advisor will be picked at the end of June or the beginning of July," Junevichius added.
The Lithuanian government said earlier that it expects to announce the actual privatisation tender for the company at the end of the year and to sign a contract with the winner in February 1998.
The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development said earlier that it was interested in obtaining an equity stake in the phone company.
